page.title: 10 SOIL
page.content: The{South Downs}are made of chalk and covered with a thin layer of soil. At the bottom{Kingley Vale}there is a small chalk pit to show the depth of soil. We could see about 30 cm. of soil that had been naturally eroded from the top of the hill thousands of years ago . This soil provides rich pasture for grazing eg.at West Stoke Farm. At the top of the hill we found a fence that separated the grass covered Downs from a wheat field. Here we saw evidence of modern day erosion. We noticed wheat growing on exposed chalk. The topsoil had been washed or blown away.
